goals.question: What is the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of life expectancy vs GDP per capita
goals.rationale: This visualization can help us understand if there is a correlation between a country's wealth and the life expectancy of its citizens.

goals.question: What is the trend of population growth over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of population vs year
goals.rationale: This visualization can help us understand if the world population is increasing or decreasing over time.

goals.question: What is the distribution of income per person across different countries?
goals.visualization: Box plot of income per person
goals.rationale: This visualization can help us understand the spread of income per person across different countries and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of child mortality rate across different countries?
goals.rationale: This visualization can help us understand the spread of child mortality rate across different countries and identify any patterns or outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between fertility rate and life expectancy?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of fertility rate vs life expectancy
goals.rationale: This visualization can help us understand if there is a correlation between a country's fertility rate and the life expectancy of its citizens.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['gdpPercap'], data['lifeExp'])
    plt.xlabel('GDP per Capita')
    plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['year'], format='%Y', errors='ignore')
    data_grouped = data.groupby('year')['population'].sum().reset_index()
    
    plt.plot(data_grouped['year'], data_grouped['population'])
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    plt.title("What is the trend of population growth over time?")
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.boxplot(data['income_per_person'])
    plt.title("What is the distribution of income per person across different countries?", wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel("Countries")
    plt.ylabel("Income per person")
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    ax = plt.gca()
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['child_mortality_rate'], bins=20)
    plt.xlabel('Child Mortality Rate')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of child mortality rate across different countries?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['fertility_rate'], data['life_expectancy'])
    plt.xlabel('Fertility Rate')
    plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between fertility rate and life expectancy?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
